Context:
The College has a Sexual Harassment and Sexual Violence Policy to support survivors and engage in a fair complaints process. They offer confidential services for students who have experienced sexual violence, regardless of when or where it occurred. Services can be accessed at three different locations: 200 King St. E., Room 246; Casa Loma: 160 Kendal Ave., Building C, Room C221; and Waterfront: 51 Dockside Dr., Room 230. The contact email for these services is svra@georgebrown.ca and the phone number is 416-415-5000 ext. 3450. The services are confidential and offered to all students, staff, and administration at the college. For more information about sexual violence resources or to sign up for college news and updates, visit georgebrown.ca. Additional information can be found on their land acknowledgment page. The Office of Anti-Racism, Equity and Human Rights Services is located at 200 King St. East, Room 264D; 160 Kendal Ave, Building C, Room C221; and 51 Dockside Drive, Room 230. Their phone number is 415-2000 and TTY number is 1-877-515-5559. The college's Sexual and Gender-Based Violence Response Advisor (SGBVRA) provides support for students who are unsure about what to do or how to get help, regardless of whether the sexual violence occurred on or off campus or a long time ago. Students will be supported in their choices and decisions without any pressure to follow a specific path. The college's services are available to all students, staff, and administration.

No information about specific programs offered by the college was extracted from the text.
